abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Enterprise Institutional
            Development Project will support the Government's
            public enterprise (PE) sector adjustment program. The
            principle objectives of the project are to improve the
            performance of the sector and to reduce its burden on public
            finances. These objectives are to be achieved by action in
            four key areas: (a) economic policy reforms; (b) financial
            sector reforms; (c) institutional and legal reforms; and (d)
            rationalization of the sector through restructuring and
            divestiture. These reforms are expected to: (1) improve
            public resource management; (2) reduce private sector policy
            distortions; (3) enhance public enterprise performance; and
            (4) reduce the burden of public enterprises on public
            finances and the banking system. The project provides the
            institutional support needed by Government to extend and
            deepen its public enterprise reform efforts. project permits
            the Government to acquire the necessary technical and
            administrative capacity to formulate and implement reform
            measures thr a program of general support to the BEP (Bureau
            des entreprises publiq the MFIN (Ministry of Finance and
            Commerce). The project further inclu studies leading to the
            development of additional reforms; (c) a compre training
            program; and (d) advisory services and other support to
            restr OPT (Office des postes et telecommunications).
